e4: Adopting the new policy aligns with ethical business practices and builds trust with investors. Although short-term market reactions might be negative, long-term benefits of transparency and investor confidence outweigh the potential risks.  Maintaining the current practice is ethically problematic, even if it avoids immediate market backlash.
e5: An ethical reporting policy is transparent, accurate, and unbiased.  It presents a fair and complete picture of the company's financial performance without manipulation or intentional obfuscation.  It also considers the potential impact on all stakeholders, including retail investors who may be less sophisticated.  Consistency in reporting methods over time is crucial for comparability and avoiding undue market volatility.
e6: I would ask the management team to quantify the potential short-term market impact of the policy change.  I would also want to understand their plan to communicate the change effectively to investors and mitigate any potential misunderstanding or negative perception.  Finally, I'd want to know what steps they would take to ensure the new policy is consistently and accurately applied.
